intro: Dacryodes glabra, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, light-colored bark and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by globose, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in moist lowland forests and is valued for its durable, aromatic wood. Dacryodes glabra also has medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
